name: Room 216
body:
### Welcome to Room 216

Room 216 is the home of the Computer Club at CHS and the Programming, Adv. Programming, and APCS classes. 
This is our github where projects, ideas, and other information can be posted and accessed. 

If you have something to commit to this site, please let a teacher or senior know. 


### Programming Self-Study Resources
If you want to study a language and dive head first, pick one and use one of the free eBooks, interactive courses, or guides we hand selected.

### C or C++
    [Learn C (Interactive, online)](http://www.learn-c.org/)

### C#
    [C# Yellow Book (Introduction, eBook)](http://www.robmiles.com/c-yellow-book/Rob%20Miles%20CSharp%20Yellow%20Book%202012.pdf)
    [C# Essentials (Reference, online)](http://www.techotopia.com/index.php/C_Sharp_Essentials)

### Github
    [Interactive Github Tutorial (online)](http://try.github.io/levels/1/challenges/10)

### HTML/CSS
    Yes, html and css are not programming languages. They are design languages with a markdown. You still can (and should) learn them if you want to make your own website.
    [HTMLDog Tutorials](http://www.htmldog.com/)
    [W3Schools CSS](http://www.w3schools.com/css/)
    [W3Schools HTML](http://www.w3schools.com/html/)


### Java
    Java is taught in AP Computer Science here at CHS. If you want more info/tutorials about java, there are a few books in the room.
    [Learn Java (Interactive, online)](http://www.learnjavaonline.org/)
    [Oracle Java Tutorials](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/)

### Lua
    [Programming in Lua](http://www.lua.org/pil/)

### Objective-C
    [Apple Developer Library (online)](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/navigation/)

### PHP
    [Practical PHP (online)](http://www.tuxradar.com/practicalphp)

### Python
    [Learn Python (Interactive, online)](http://www.learnpython.org/)
    [Make your own computer game with Python (eBook, online)](http://inventwithpython.com/)
    [Learn Python the Hard Way (online)](http://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/)
    [Python for Fun (online)](http://www.openbookproject.net/py4fun/)

### Ruby
    [TryRuby (Interactive, online)](http://tryruby.org/levels/1/challenges/0)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
